document_title: Nephrotic syndrome: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
People with nephrotic syndrome will have symptoms such as:
Swelling: This symptom often appears around the eyes, ankles and feet, and may be accompanied by peritoneal and pleural effusion; Urine appears foamy; Increased body weight due to excess water not being able to escape; Poor appetite, fatigue; Loss of appetite.
